data.title: The present-day state of spring runoff in the territory of Ural Hydrogeological Massif (The Middle Urals)
data.meta_description: Data on the spring runoff of the mountain-folded part of the Middle Urals are generalized to analyze the transformation of its macrocomponent composition f
data.text:
Gaev, A.Ya, Adigamova, Z.S., Komissarova, O.Yu., et al., On the Need to Supply Environmentally Pure Drinking and Table Water to the Population, Mater. mezhdunar. nauchno-prakticheskoi konf. “Tekhnogennaya transformatsiya geologicheskoi sredy” (Intern. Scientific-Pract. Conf. “Technogenic Transformation of the Geological Environment), Yekaterinburg, 2002, pp. 37–39.

Gidrogeologicheskie osnovy okhrany podzemnykh vod (Hydrogeological Principles of Groundwater Protection), Kozlovskii, E.A., Ed., Moscow: TsMP GKNT, 1984.

Intern. Symp. “Clear Water of Russia-2005”), Yekaterinburg: FGUP RosNIIVKh, 2005, pp. 128–129.

Elokhina, S.N., Yurkin, A.S., and Shirokov, M.Yu., Present-day Lines in Studying Spring Runoff, Mater. nauchno-metodicheskoi konf. “XI Tolstikhinskie chteniya. Tendentsii i perspektivy razvitiya gidrogeologii i inzhenernoi geologii v usloviyakh rynochnoi ekonomiki Rossii” (Proc. Sci.-Metod. Conf. “XI Tolskikhin Conf. Trends and Perspectives in the Development of Hydrogeology and Engineering Geology under Market Economy in Russia), St. Petersburg, 2004, pp. 19–21.

Kiryukhin, V.A., Regional’naya gidrogeologiya (Regional Hydrogeology), St. Petersburg: GGI, 2005.

Limantseva, O.A, Lisenkov, A.B., Ryzhenko, B.N., and Shvets, V.M., Dynamics of Groundwater Chemistry in the Water-Rock System in a Megalopolis, Vodn. Resur., 2006, vol. 33, no. 1, pp. 78–88 [Water Resour. (Engl. Transl.), vol. 33, no. 1, pp. 71–81].

Spravochnoe rukovodstvo gidrogeologa (Hydrogeologist’s Textbook) Maksimov, V.M.., Ed., Moscow: Nedra, 1979, vol. 1.

Shvets, V.M., Lisenkov, A.B., and Popov, E.V., Rodniki Moskvy (Moscow Springs), Moscow: Nauch. Mir, 2002.
